result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James A Garr

defendant.name: Garr, James A

records.addlTxt: Review hearing on December 15, 2022 at 03:45 pm.

2:31 PM Defendant James A Garr appeared by video.  Attorney Laurie Sazama Osberg in court for James A Garr.  Attorney Emily Nelson appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.
Extended supervision revocation hearing scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 03:45 pm.
Signed by Judge Wickstrom
Letter dated 9/21/22 from Atty Osberg concerning JT for this case.
Status conference on October 11, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference on October 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial - 12 person on October 13, 2022 at 08:00 am.

2:38 PM Prosecuting attorney Emily Margaret Nelson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant James A Garr in court.  Attorney Laurie Sazama Osberg in court for James A Garr. Matter set for ARGN.   Waived reading of INFO.  DE entered NG pleas to all counts.  Attorney Osberg informed Court she has updated State as to DE compliance with treatment.  JT set for 2 days on 10/13 and 10/14/22 as a #1.   If parties wish to enter a settlement prior they are to contact JA for a new court date.  Adj. 2:41 PM.

Defendant is not to consume or possess alcohol.  Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars taverns or liquor stores or any other establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol. No possession/consumption or use of illegal or illicit drugs, or any substance intended to use to alter mental state or mood.  Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  No possession of medications not prescribed to you by a physician.
Arraignment on May 10, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

2:41 PM Defendant James A Garr appeared by video.  Attorney Laurie Sazama Osberg in court for James A Garr.  Attorney Emily Margaret Nelson in court for State of Wisconsin. DE appears from RC Jail.  Mr Garr will waive PH hearing scheduled for today.  Court instructs on waiver of PH, DE understands waiver, makes waiver knowingly, freely, voluntarily and intelligently. Court will accept waiver of PH. The court finds probable cause exists, will bind over for Trial.  Set for Arraignment May 10, 2022 @ 2:45pm. 

Atty would like to address bond. DE has resided at his current address, was employed, has a DL to make court appearances, would like to enroll in treatment. 

Court will reduce bond to $500.00 cash, Defendant is not to consume or possess alcohol.  Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars taverns or liquor stores or any other establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol. No possession/consumption or use of illegal or illicit drugs, or any substance intended to use to alter mental state or mood.  Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  No possession of medications not prescribed to you by a physician. Must reside with his mother. Must re-enroll in treatment at Arbor Place and report effort of enrollment to the court.  Adj 2:51pm

Preliminary hearing on April 19, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

03:09 PM Defendant James A Garr in court with attorney Laurie Sazama Osberg.  Defendant James A Garr in custody.  Emily Margaret Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  James A Garr appeared by video means with Attorney.    Waive formal reading of the CC.  Set for PH April 19, 2022 @ 4:00PM. Adj 3:11PM.
22GF78 into 22CF85
Hearing on April 12, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

1:07 Atty Knaak appeared via video with DE, in custody.  Atty Barna appeared for State of Wisconsin.   Court did riverside bond.  Atty Knaak requesting a reduction.  Atty Knaak, states DE lives in Elk Mound, has transportation and employment although DE is currently on leave.  Atty Barna requests riverside bond continue, previous cases are drug related and may be a flight risk as no connection to Rusk County.  Court makes findings, Riverside bond to continue.  Int App hearing set for 4/12/22 at 1:00 PM.
Inmate receipt
Any cash bond posted for Defendant shall be used for fines, costs and restitution pursuant to WI STAT 969.13(5)
